title: Woodstock
summary: Woodstock Music and Art Fair, commonly referred to simply as Woodstock,  was a music festival held August 15–18, 1969, on Max Yasgur's dairy farm in Bethel, New York,[2][3] 40 miles (65 km) southwest of the town of Woodstock. Billed as "an Aquarian Exposition: 3 Days of Peace & Music" and alternatively referred to as the Woodstock Rock Festival, it attracted an audience of more than 400,000.[2][4][5][6] Thirty-two acts performed outdoors despite sporadic rain.[7]
